meanings.definition: The greedy pursuit of wealth and material possessions.
meanings.sent1: Her constant mammonisms led her to prioritize money over relationships.
meanings.sent2: Some people's mammonisms drive them to work long hours to acquire more things.
meanings.sent3: His mammonisms were so extreme that he even collected coins from the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, mammonisms can blind people to the true value of things.
meanings.sent5: The character's mammonisms were portrayed through his obsession with counting his money.

meanings.definition: The belief that money and material wealth are the most important things in life.
meanings.sent1: Their mammonisms made them view success solely in terms of financial gain.
meanings.sent2: The preacher warned against falling into the trap of mammonisms and losing sight of spiritual values.
meanings.sent3: Despite his mammonisms, he found true happiness in simple moments with loved ones.
meanings.sent4: The allure of mammonisms can cloud one's judgment and lead to poor decision-making.
meanings.sent5: Her mammonisms were shattered when she realized that money couldn't buy genuine friendships.
